faqs.question: Upgrade your mac's OS version for better app experience
faqs.answer: We have now officially retired the support for 'Kalam' Kernel on 'macOS 10.13' (OS X El High Sierra) and lower. Only the 'Legacy' MTP mode will continue working on these outdated machines. Only the latest 3 versions of macOS will receive the 'Kalam' Kernel updates, which includes new devices support, fixes, stability improvements.

faqs.question: My device is not connecting
faqs.answer: 1. Quit Google drive, Android File Transfer, Dropbox, OneDrive, Preview (for macOS ventura) or any other app that might be reading USB. Uninstall 'Android File Transfer' by Google if it keeps popping up everytime you connect your Android device. 2. If you face frequent device disconnections, turn off 'USB Hotplug' in Settings > General Tab. 3. Unlock your Android device. 4. Unplug your device and reconnect it. 5. On your device, tap the 'Charging this device via USB' notification and select 'File Transfer'. 6. It should connect automatically. Check if 'Enable auto device detection (USB Hotplug)' is enabled under Settings > General Tab. 7. Tap on the 'Refresh' button in the app if the device doesn't get connected automatically.

faqs.question: I have Google drive installed on my computer
faqs.answer: The most recent versions of Google drive is known to interfere with OpenMTP. Simply quiting Google drive may fix this issue. Follow the basic connection steps: unlock your device, unplug and reconnect, select File Transfer mode, and it should connect automatically.

faqs.question: I have Dropbox installed on my computer
faqs.answer: The most recent versions of Dropbox is known to interfere with OpenMTP. Simply quiting Dropbox may fix this issue. Follow the basic connection steps: unlock your device, unplug and reconnect, select File Transfer mode, and it should connect automatically.

faqs.question: The app goes blank while trying to connect a Samsung device
faqs.answer: 1. Uninstall Samsung SmartSwitch, if installed. 2. Restart OpenMTP. 3. Follow the basic connection steps: unlock your device, unplug and reconnect, select File Transfer mode, and it should connect automatically.

faqs.question: I keep seeing 'An error occurred while setting up the phone'
faqs.answer: Follow the basic connection steps: unlock your Android device, unplug and reconnect it, tap the 'Charging this device via USB' notification and select 'File Transfer', it should connect automatically, and tap the 'Refresh' button if needed.

faqs.question: I keep seeing 'Allow storage access to the device'
faqs.answer: 1. Unlock your Android device. 2. Tap on the 'Allow' button if you see the 'Allow access to the device data' pop up. 3. If you don't see the pop up, reconnect your device and follow the basic connection steps. 4. If you are prompted multiple times, reconnect your device and try again.

faqs.question: I am prompted to 'Allow access to the device data' multiple times
faqs.answer: 1. Unlock your Android device. 2. Unplug and reconnect it. 3. Tap the 'Transferring media files' notification and select 'Charging' first. 4. Then tap the 'Charging this device via USB' notification and select 'File Transfer'. 5. It should connect automatically. 6. Tap the 'Refresh' button if needed. 7. Tap 'Allow' if you see the device data access pop up.

faqs.question: Refresh button is stuck
faqs.answer: 1. Unlock your Android device. 2. Unplug and reconnect it. 3. Tap the 'Transferring media files' notification and select 'Charging' first. 4. Then tap the 'Charging this device via USB' notification and select 'File Transfer'. 5. It should connect automatically. 6. Tap the 'Refresh' button if needed. 7. Tap 'Allow' if you see the device data access pop up.

faqs.question: I keep seeing 'Multiple MTP devices detected'
faqs.answer: 1. Unplug all your MTP devices. 2. Plug in your MTP device. 3. Follow the basic connection steps: select File Transfer mode, it should connect automatically, and tap the 'Refresh' button if needed.

faqs.question: My device gets disconnected everytime the display goes into sleep
faqs.answer: In a very rare case your device may get disconnected when your display goes into sleep, disrupting active file transfers. 1. Unlock your Android device. 2. Open device Settings > Display > Sleep and set it to 30 minutes or the highest available. 3. Follow the basic connection steps.

faqs.question: I keep seeing 'Quit Android File Transfer app (by Google) and Refresh'
faqs.answer: Quit and uninstall Google's 'Android File Transfer' app. Then follow the basic connection steps without unplugging the phone first.

faqs.question: My phone is still not connecting
faqs.answer: 1. Uninstall Samsung SmartSwitch, if installed. 2. Try changing the MTP mode in Settings > Tab > Change the 'MTP Mode'. 3. Follow the basic connection steps: unlock your device, unplug and reconnect, select File Transfer mode, and it should connect automatically.

faqs.question: I keep seeing 'Operation not permitted' error whenever I try to open a folder in the Local Disk pane
faqs.answer: macOS requires access to your Documents, Desktop, Downloads, and Bin folders, iCloud Drive, third-party cloud storage folders, removable media, and external drives. 1. Tap 'Ok' when you see 'OpenMTP would like to access files in your...' popup. 2. If you keep getting the error, go to System Preferences > Security and Privacy > Privacy Tab. 3. Click 'Click the lock to make changes' and authenticate. 4. Find 'Files and Folders' in the left pane, select it. 5. Find OpenMTP in the right pane and mark all folders you want to provide access to.

faqs.question: I am still being denied access to some of the folders in the Local Disk pane
faqs.answer: macOS requires access to various system folders. If you still get 'Operation not permitted' errors, you may need to grant 'Full Disk Access'. 1. Open System Preferences > Security and Privacy > Privacy Tab. 2. Click 'Click the lock to make changes' and authenticate. 3. Find 'Full Disk Access' in the left pane. 4. Find OpenMTP in the right pane. 5. If OpenMTP is not in the list, tap the '+' button and select OpenMTP by navigating to the Applications folder.
